core.compoundterm
Class CompoundTerm

java.lang.Object
  core.compoundterm.CompoundTerm
Direct Known Subclasses:
Altern, Invert, Plug, PrimitiveTerm, Quot
public abstract class CompoundTerm
extends java.lang.Object

CompoundTerm is the main class of the package connector. Contains methods that permits creation and management of terms,including the main concept of message port; through this concept, this library creates links between component that share same input/output port. Each term, when it is initialised, must specify its input and output message ports: when two terms are composed, this class deals with decide if there are common message port: if at least one input port of a term is identically to an output port of other term, we must create link between these two term.

Author:
giacomolm

getSources

public java.util.Collection<Port> getSources()
The method returns terms sources ports

Returns:
Collection containing sources ports of the compound term

addSource

public void addSource(Port source)
Add source port to term. If the port is already been added to term, we must control if we need to create a link between existing terms.

Parameters:
source - Message port to include in the term

addSources

public void addSources(java.util.Collection<Port> sourcesuri)
This method is semantically identical to addSource, differs only by the parameter type. Now we have a collection of port that we want to add to term.

Parameters:
sourcesuri - Collection of ports

addReceiver

public void addReceiver(Port receiver)
Adds output port to term. Simply adds message endpoint that receives output message from this term.

Parameters:
receiver - Port the output exchange

getReceivers

public java.util.Collection<Port> getReceivers()
Returns all receiver ports of this term

Returns:
Collection associated with this term

addReceivers

public void addReceivers(java.util.Collection<Port> receiversUri)
This method is semantically identical to addReceiver, differs only by the parameter type. Now we have a collection of receiver ports that we want to add to term.

Parameters:
receiversUri - Collection of port added to term

public boolean isComposed()
We control if the term is a component of compound term

Returns:
true if this term is a component of another compound term

public abstract void setMessage(java.lang.String uri,

Add an input message to term. It allows the messagge passing betwewn nested term: from the external term to internal(s) term(s)

Parameters:
uri - source of the exchange
e - exchange received
